edu.uoc.som.jarvis.plugins.github.platform

Class GithubPlatform

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uoc.som.jarvis.core.platform.RuntimePlatform
      • edu.uoc.som.jarvis.plugins.github.platform.GithubPlatform

  • public class GithubPlatform
extends RuntimePlatform
    A RuntimePlatform class that connects and interacts with the Github API.

    This runtimePlatform manages a output connection to the Github API, and provides a set of RuntimeActions to interact with the Github API:

    • OpenIssue: open an issue on a given repository

    This class is part of jarvis' core platforms, and can be used in an execution model by importing the GithubPlatform package.

    • Field Detail

      • GITHUB_USERNAME_KEY

        public static String GITHUB_USERNAME_KEY
        The Configuration key to store the Github username.

        The GithubPlatform can handle Configuration with username/password as well as oauth token. Note that if an username/password is provided it will be used instead of the oauth token to initialize the client.

        See Also:
        GITHUB_PASSWORD_KEY, GITHUB_OAUTH_TOKEN

      • GITHUB_PASSWORD_KEY

        public static String GITHUB_PASSWORD_KEY
        The Configuration key to store the Github password associated to the defined username.

        The GithubPlatform can handle Configuration with username/password as well as oauth token. Note that if an username/password is provided it will be used instead of the oauth token to initialize the client.

        See Also:
        GITHUB_USERNAME_KEY, GITHUB_OAUTH_TOKEN

      • GITHUB_OAUTH_TOKEN

        public static String GITHUB_OAUTH_TOKEN
        The Configuration key to store the Github oauth token.

        The GithubPlatform can handle Configuration with username/password as well as oauth token. Note that if an username/password is provided it will be used instead of the oauth token to initialize the client.

        See Also:
        GITHUB_USERNAME_KEY, GITHUB_PASSWORD_KEY

    • Constructor Detail

      • GithubPlatform

        public GithubPlatform(JarvisCore jarvisCore,
                      Configuration configuration)
        Constructs a new GithubPlatform from the provided JarvisCore and Configuration.

        This constructor tries to initialize the Github client used to access the Github API by looking for the username/login or oauth token in the provided Configuration. If no authentication credentials can be found the GithubPlatform is still initialized, but will not be able to access and manipulate the Github API.

        GithubPlatform initialized with no credentials can still be used to construct Github-related RuntimeEventProviders, that will work as expected. Note that if the provided Configuration defines credentials the constructed GithubPlatform will check that these credentials are valid.

        Parameters:
        jarvisCore - the JarvisCore instance associated to this runtimePlatform
        configuration - the Configuration used to customize Github events and actions
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided jarvisCore or configuration is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the provided Configuration contains a username but does not contain a valid password
        JarvisException - if the provided credentials are not valid or if a network error occurred when accessing the Github API.

    • Method Detail

      • getGithubClient

        public com.jcabi.github.Github getGithubClient()
        Returns the Github client used to access the Github API.
        Returns:
        the Github client used to access the Github API
        Throws:
        JarvisException - if the GithubPlatform does not define a valid Github client (i.e. if the provided Configuration does not contain any credentials information or if the authentication failed).
